The human body is made up of trillions of cells. When one or more cells start to grow and divide uncontrollably, these cells can be called cancer cells.
A cell becomes a cancer cell when it invades and grows into other living tissues. These cells form tumors which can either be malignant or benign. When a tumor is benign, it doesnâ€™t have the ability to invade other tissues, and is therefore considered non-cancerous. A malignant tumor on the other hand, has this capability of spreading and growing into other tissues and tumors.
Once cancer starts, it can easily spread to other parts of the body. This process is called metastasis.
